page.title: 01General Information Bathgate
page.content: Our school is situated on the western edge of our block almost exactly in the centre. Only about one 1/24th. of our area for study is taken up with housing and shops, the rest is farmland. To the north and west of our school there are the Bathgate Hills which are used by farmers for grazing cattle. Although the farmers use these large fields, much of it can be visited by young and old people, who can enjoy hillwalking,birdwatching and visiting historical sites. Much of this area is studied by our school as part of our farming and historical studies connected to our Environmental Studies. Most of the houses in the residential areas of our block are old council houses,with only two small privately owned estates.
